title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
The FTC sued Microsoft to block its planned $75 billion purchase of Activision Blizzard, taking one of its biggest shots under the Biden administration at halting a merger of technology giants.

The agency asked a judge to halt Meta Platforms' planned acquisition of virtual-reality startup Within Unlimited.

---

Pressure is mounting on the SEC to step up enforcement of key hubs of the crypto industry after the collapse of FTX.

---

Musk's SpaceX is stepping up its efforts to win more national-security business after years of keeping its work under wraps.

---

The Biden administration has awarded its biggest pension bailout to date under a 2021 package aimed at shoring up near-insolvent retirement plans.

---

The S&P 500 rose 0.8%, ending a five-session losing streak, while the Dow and Nasdaq climbed 0.5% and 1.1%, respectively.

---

A survey of U.S. car dealers by Cox Automotive shows their outlook for sales is the gloomiest it has been since the research firm first began the poll in early 2017.

---

NHTSA is asking vehicle manufacturers about potentially defective air-bag inflators estimated to be in tens of millions of cars.

---

Amazon is rolling out a TikTok-like feature in its app that will allow purchases from a customized feed of photos and videos.
